III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During an unknown date, a youth and a staff member had an
inappropriate relationship.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Administrator 1 reported during a bedroom search on 4/28/2025 a
note was found that was written by Youth A to Youth C and the
note contained information that indicated inappropriate relations
between Youth A and Staff 1. Administrator 1 reported Staff 3
spoke with Youth A last night after the note was found and may
have more information. Administrator 1 reported she attempted to
talk to Youth A, however Youth A did not want to talk.
Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 was terminated from the facility in
October but his official termination date was 11/4/2024. Staff 1
had been employed at the facility since 5/9/2023 and typically
2

worked the afternoon shift from 2pm to 10pm. Administrator 1
reported she was informed by staff in October 2024, unable to
recall by who, Staff 1 had been in the basement with youth and
staff felt something was not right. Administrator 1 reported Staff 1
was placed on administrative leave due to the concern of being
found in the basement alone with Youth A while an internal
investigation was completed. Administrator 1 reported the plan
was to meet with Staff 1 to discuss the concerns and to move
Staff 1 to a male house however Staff 1 did not return phone calls
to Administrator 1 to come into the facility regarding the internal
investigation resulting in the facility terminating Staff 1’s
employment on 11/4/2024. Administrator 1 reported the staff who
observed the incident, unable to recall who, reported they did not
see anything inappropriate happening between Staff 1 and Youth
A but had an uneasy feeling about the situation. Administrator 1
reported Youth A did not disclose anything happened with Staff 1
at the time of the incident. Administrator 1 reported video footage
was checked and the only concern found was Staff 1 allowed
Youth A to be on his cellphone. Administrator 1 reported staff
should never be alone with a youth in the basement of the home.
Administrator 1 reported the facility had no knowledge of any
sexual inappropriate interactions between Staff 1 and Youth A
until the note was found on 4/28/2025.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Youth A reported she wrote a note to Youth C that was
confiscated by staff. Youth A reported in a prior note she received
from Youth C, Youth C asked her to tell him something no one
else knows about her and she told him about Staff 1. Youth A
reported Staff 1 use to work at the facility and she was “close” to
him. Youth A reported she could not describe their relationship
but reported Staff 1 flirted with her. Youth A reported Staff 1
asked her to be in a relationship outside the facility and she
believed he asked her to be in a relationship with him at the
facility. Youth A reported Staff 1 would call her “beautiful”. Youth
A reported she did not remember if Staff 1 talked sexually to her.
Youth A reported Staff 1 “put his hand on the areas that should
not be touched” and stated “private areas” under her clothing.
Youth A reported it happened more than one time. Youth A
reported Staff 1 touched her breast under her shirt when she was
not wearing a bra approximately four to five times and digitally
penetrated her at least twice. Youth A reported Staff 1 did this at
night when he would be “semi” in her doorway. Youth A reported
this occurred when she first arrived at the facility September
through October. Youth A reported other staff, unable to recall
3

who, were at the house when this occurred, and all the other
youth were in bed. Youth A reported Staff 1 told her to promise to
take it to the grave and not tell anyone. Youth A reported Staff 1
kissed her on the lips and neck while he would have his hand in
her pants as well as other times at the facility. Youth A reported
she did not recall if Staff 1 was saying anything to her when he
had his hands on her breast or was digitally penetrating her.
Youth A reported no one ever witnessed or saw Staff 1 doing this
to her. Youth A reported there is a camera outside her bedroom
door and she thought it would be on camera. Youth A reported it
“somewhat stopped” between her and Staff 1 when she got a
boyfriend at the facility however it still happened just not as
frequent. Youth A reported she told Youth B about it. Youth A
reported she had no contact with Staff 1 since he no longer works
at the facility. Youth A reported Youth D and her were Staff 1’s
favorite youth as Staff 1 would call them both his favorites. Youth
A reported Staff 1 would tell her that she was different from the
other youth. Youth A reported she “somewhat thought it was ok,
not normal, but ok” what Staff 1 was doing. Youth A reported Staff
1 told her they could both get into a lot of trouble and had her
promise to take it to the grave one night when they were talking in
her bedroom door when she was in the observation room. Youth
A reported she was not in a relationship with Staff 1, she stated it
was somewhat mutual and reported Staff 1 asked her “to suck his
dick” and she did once while Staff 1 was standing in her bedroom
door. Youth A reported there was only one midnight staff working
that night who she thought was in the dining room. Youth A
reported Staff 1 told her how he was sexually assaulted and talked
about his family. Youth A reported Staff 1 showed her pictures of
his family on his phone and they would watch KKK videos
together during black history month.
Youth A reported she recalled a specific night when she was in
the basement alone with Staff 1 and Staff 3 found her and Staff 1
alone in the basement. Youth A reported no inappropriate
touching occurred during that night in the basement with Staff 1.
Youth A reported Staff 3 talked to her yesterday after the note was
found and shared with her that Staff 3 had confronted Staff 1
about his boundaries with Youth A that night after finding them
alone in the basement.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Youth B reported Staff 1 was a former employee that worked at
the facility. Youth B reported Youth A told her she “sucked on his
dick” in the basement of the house. Youth B reported Youth A did
not tell her how many times this occurred. Youth B reported she
4

told Youth A to tell staff and Youth A told her she “wanted to take
it to the grave”. Youth B reported Youth A told her after Staff 1 no
longer worked at the facility. Youth B reported she was in Sherk
house when Staff 1 worked at the facility. Youth B reported on
one occasion she was in the basement with Staff 1 and Youth D
watching a movie and Staff 1 let her and Youth D lay their heads
on his shoulder, and he held their hands. Youth B reported Staff 1
got mad and said he was supposed to be a “godly man” and “was
not supposed to do anything with people younger than him and
that he was not being true to his faith”. Youth B reported the
movie was being streamed off of Staff 1’s personal computer and
Youth D went to hit the space bar to pause the movie and “porn”
came on the computer. Youth B reported she feels Youth A is
honest and Youth A has never lied to her about anything. Youth B
reported Youth D never reported any concerns to her about Staff
1. Youth B reported it is not “common” to hold male staff members
hands at the facility or lay her head on their shoulders however
she did not feel anything was odd about Staff 1 allowing it to occur
as he was very religious. Youth B reported no staff witnessed her
and Youth D holding hands and laying their heads on Staff 1’s
shoulder. Youth B reported Staff 1 never told her not to tell
anyone about anything. Youth B denied Staff 1 ever “flirting”,
making inappropriate comments to her that made her feel
uncomfortable, or calling her nicknames or giving compliments
that made her uncomfortable.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Youth C reported he and Youth A have been in a relationship for
two to three weeks. Youth C reported he and Youth A write notes
back and forth to one another and the notes were recently found
in his bedroom. Youth C reported the most recent note Youth A
wrote him was taken by staff prior to him getting to read it. Youth
C reported he does not know Staff 1. Youth C reported Youth A
had asked him in a prior letter for him to tell her something he has
never told anyone before and in his last letter to Youth A, he
asked her to tell him something he has never told anyone before,
however that letter he never got to read as staff took it from him.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Staff 2 reported she worked with Staff 1 “hand and hand a lot”.
Staff 2 reported initially she had no concerns with Staff 1 as she
had personally never witnessed any issues regarding Staff 1’s
boundaries. Staff 2 reported she began transitioning into the role
of the assistant supervisor of the home and staff began coming to
5

her with concerns. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 and Staff 7 shared
concerns. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 shared concerns that Staff 1
would go sit at Youth A’s bedroom door after shift and stay late
talking to Youth A. Staff 2 did not recall Staff 7’s concerns. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 would work at Sherk house and come to Ashmun
house after he got off work to say hi to Youth A and talk to her.
Staff 2 reported while Staff 1 was on shift at Sherk house he
would come to Ashmun house to get something and would stay
longer than he should have talking to Youth A. Staff 2 reported
Youth A and Youth D were “fond” of Staff 1 and were both “very
upset” when Staff 1 was no longer employed at the facility. Staff 2
reported Youth A nor Youth D never reported any concerns to her
regarding Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 would come to the
facility on his off days to grab something he had left or would
check to see if any additional help was needed which Staff 2
reported seemed off to her but not concerning at the time. Staff 2
reported she did not recall any situations where Staff 1 was alone
in the basement with any youth. Staff 2 reported one time she
was working with Staff 1, and they were watching a movie with the
youth and Staff 1 fell asleep and she had to wake him up. Staff 2
reported cameras were being worked on in one area of the house
and were not functioning for a short period of time and staff were
not supposed to take youth into that room, however Staff 1 would
still take two youth, unable to recall who, into the room. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 mainly worked at Sherk house, so she found it
odd how he and Youth A had created a bond as Youth A was in
Ashmun house. Staff 2 reported she is aware of one time Staff 1
took Youth A for a walk alone however did not have any further
information. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 would come over after his
shift to sit outside Youth A’s bedroom door as they “supposedly
built a relationship over both being biracial” and Youth A wanted to
learn about black history. Staff 2 reported it is not normal at the
facility for staff to sit outside youth doors for the length of time
Staff 1 sat outside Youth A's bedroom door. Staff 2 reported she
attempted to address her concerns with Staff 1 and Staff 1 would
tell her that he “is strong in his religion” and any concerns she had
he would tell her “that is not who he is as a man”. Staff 2 reported
youth seemed to be fond of Staff 1 and thought he was a good
staff. Staff 2 reported she shared her concerns with Supervisor
and Administrator 1.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Staff 3 reported Staff 1 mainly worked at Sherk house however
she did work with him as Sherk house collaborates with Ashmun
house. Staff 3 reported she had concerns with Staff 1’s
6

boundaries as she described Staff 1 did not “uphold” boundaries
and she made Supervisor aware of her concerns via email. Staff
3 reported Youth A came to her “a few times” over a two-week
period and asked her to call Staff 1 to come sit outside her door.
Staff 3 reported she later found out from Staff 5 (she believed)
how Staff 1 would come over after his shift was over at Sherk
house and sit outside Youth A’s bedroom door for one to two
hours. Staff 3 reported she never witnessed Staff 1 sitting outside
Youth A’s bedroom door. Staff 3 reported there was an incident
where Youth A had a boyfriend at the facility who sent her sexual
notes and Youth A showed Staff 1 and Staff 1 told Youth A, he
would not take the notes from her and would hide the notes from
other staff at the facility. Staff 3 reported she addressed this
concern via teams which the facility uses as a messaging system
amongst staff. Staff 3 reported she also addressed it directly with
Staff 1 and informed him it was inappropriate as well as told
Supervisor. Staff 3 reported she worked with Staff 1 on the
Sunday before he was let go from the facility and she was “upset”
with his boundaries. Staff 3 reported she told Staff 1 to go with
her to get gas in the van and she reported she told Staff 1 she
was concerned with his boundaries and “cussed him out”. Staff 3
reported she was concerned as Staff 1 had been one-on-one with
Youth A “a lot” that day and she did not like when she went
downstairs and saw them sitting on the couch together. Staff 3
reported she did not see anything inappropriate however she was
overall concerned with the length of time Staff 1 was spending
with Youth A during the shift and the “favoritism”. Staff 3 reported
she told Staff 1 she was concerned about his boundaries with
Youth A and Staff 1 responded stating he was glad Staff 3 noticed
this issue as well and advised Staff 3 he was bothered by Youth
A’s poor boundaries with him. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 stated he
did not know how to handle Youth A’s poor boundaries with him.
Staff 3 reported she informed management of this incident that
night and the conversation with Staff 1 and Staff 1 was placed on
administrative leave for an internal investigation and never
returned to work after that.
Staff 3 reported she did not have any firsthand knowledge
regarding Staff 1 and Youth D. Staff 3 reported she was heard,
unable to recall from who, of a situation were Youth A and Youth
D were “snuggled up” with Staff 1 and had their heads laying on
his shoulders while watching a movie. Staff 3 reported she
believed there was a picture of it sent to Supervisor. Staff 3
reported she did not have a timeframe of when this occurred as
she did not see it and only heard about it. Staff 3 reported she
heard Staff 1 had been talking to Youth D outside the facility.
Staff 3 reported she heard that this occurred after Youth D left the
7

facility as Youth D continued to attend the same church the facility
attends.
Staff 3 reported she spoke with Youth A yesterday. Staff 3
reported Youth A told her about a note regarding her and Staff 1.
Staff 3 reported Youth A told her Staff 1 used to like her and Youth
C and Staff 1 asked her if she wanted to date outside the facility.
Staff 3 reported Youth A told her Staff 1 was jealous of her
relationships with boys at the facility that were in her age group.
Staff 3 reported Youth A told her she felt guilty for talking about
Staff 1 as she swore to him that she would take it to the grave.
Staff 3 reported Youth A did not disclose any details to her
regarding what happened with Staff 1. Staff 3 reported she
observed Youth A’s interactions with Staff 1 and Youth A would
talk to Staff 1 in a “baby voice” when he worked at the facility and
when she brought this to Staff 1’s attention, Staff 1 reported to her
“that makes my belly hurt”. Staff 3 reported she heard from Staff 4
about an incident where Staff 1 was standing outside Youth A’s
bedroom door and Youth A was in her sports bra. Staff 3 reported
she was concerned about what she heard as Staff 4 told her Staff
1 did not correct Youth A about being inappropriately dressed or
leave her doorway and Staff 4 told Youth A to put a shirt on.
Staff 3 reported she verbalized her concerns to Staff 1 and Staff 1
would ask her what he should do at which time she told Staff 1
that it is his responsibility to set and hold the boundary with the
youth. Staff 3 reported all the concerns with Staff 1 started in the
last month of his employment at the facility. Staff 3 reported Staff
1 tried to date all the female staff at the facility as he was the only
male staff that worked at Sherk/Ashmun house. Staff 3 reported
Staff 1 gave her a gut feeling that she did not like. Staff 3 reported
she spoke with Youth A yesterday regarding Staff 1, she may
have said something insinuating that he was a pedophile.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 4/30/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective. Staff 4
reported she mainly works in Ashmun house however
occasionally she works in other houses. Staff 4 reported she
worked with Staff 1 a few times and he was employed for the first
month she worked at the facility. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 would talk
to Youth A often as Youth A was very aware of her ethnicity and
Staff 1 would talk with Youth A about their ethnicity and black
history. Staff 4 reported Youth A preferred to talk to staff of the
same ethnicity and there were not many staff that worked at
Ashmun that were, so she did not find it odd that Youth A wanted
to talk with Staff 1. Staff 4 reported there were times Youth A
asked for Staff 1 to come over to talk to her after he was off shift,
and she never thought anything about it until she witnessed Staff
8

1 talking to Youth A while Youth A was in a sports bra. Staff 4
reported she began working at the facility in September and only
worked with Staff 1 for a month or two prior to Staff 1 no longer
being employed at the facility however did not recall specifically
when this occurred. Staff 4 reported one night Staff 1 had worked
at Sherk house and came over after his shift around 10/11pm and
was sitting talking to Youth A at her bedroom door when Staff 4
walked by. Staff 4 reported she noticed Youth A was in a sports
bra and sweats or shorts. Staff 4 reported she immediately sent
Staff 1 a message on the teams app which the facility uses to
communicate. Staff 4 reported she did not know when Staff 1
noticed the message she sent him, as Staff 1 continued to sit and
talk to Youth A. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 later replied to her
message and stated he had not noticed Youth A was in a sports
bra which she found odd due to it being a male staff (Staff 1)
outside her bedroom door. Staff 4 reported she shared this
concern with Supervisor as well at the time. Staff 4 reported staff
are trained to prompt youth about appropriate attire and if youth
are not properly clothed, they are to close their bedroom door.
Staff 4 reported Youth A was getting ready for bed and she had
slept in only her sports bra a time or two but had been addressed
to also wear a t-shirt. Staff 4 reported she did not know how long
Staff 1 stayed and talked to Youth A that night as she finished her
paperwork for the shift and left. Staff 4 reported she had no other
personal experience of boundary issues with Staff 1 that she
witnessed other than Youth A being in a sports bra however she
heard about other incidents. Staff 4 reported she heard Staff 1
spent a lot of time with Youth D at Sherk house. Staff 4 reported
after Staff 1 was no longer employed at the facility, she heard
about an incident where Staff 1 was in the basement watching a
movie with several youth, unsure what youth, and Staff 1 was on
the couch with two youth covered with a blanket. Staff 4 did not
recall who she heard about the incident from. Staff 4 reported she
“just had a bad vibe” with Staff 1 and described him as quiet and
“just off vibe”. Staff 4 reported she recalled a handful of times,
meaning five or six, where Staff 1 would be outside Youth A’s
bedroom door after bedtime. Staff 4 reported she never saw Staff
1 outside any other youth’s bedroom doors, as he would say hi to
other youth but would talk to Youth A. Staff 4 reported Staff 1
typically would talk to Youth A for at least thirty minutes.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 4/30/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective. Staff 5
reported she works overnight Thursday through Saturday at the
facility and occasionally will pick up other night shifts. Staff 5
reported Staff 1 asked her permission three times to come talk to
9

a few youth, once to talk to Youth E, once to talk to Youth F. Staff
5 did not recall who the other youth was. Staff 5 reported Staff 1
talked to Youth E at her bedroom door and Youth F in the living
room. Staff 5 did not recall Staff 1 ever coming over to talk to
Youth A. Staff 5 reported Staff 1 worked in Sherk the nights this
occurred and would come over to Ashmun. Staff 5 reported she
never heard or saw anything inappropriate. Staff 5 reported she
would complete checks on youth during this time and Staff 1 only
stayed the time in between her completing a check. Staff 5
reported she never heard any sexual conversations between Staff
1 and Youth A. Staff 5 reported there have been other staff at the
facility that will come talk to a youth at the end of their shift if a
youth requests to speak with a specific staff. Staff 5 reported staff
go back and forth between Sherk and Ashmun house often. Staff
5 reported she had limited contact with Staff 1 as they never
worked the same shift and the most she spoke with Staff 1 was to
say “hi” and “wish him well” when he left for the night. Staff 5
reported she never heard any concerns from staff or youth
regarding Staff 1.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Therapist reported she is the assigned therapist for Youth A.
Youth A never talked to Therapist about Staff 1, any male staff,
regarding any concerns of boundaries. Therapist reported Youth
A is “very reserved” with her. Therapist reported none of the
youth she has worked with at the facility have reported any
concerns to her regarding Staff 1. Therapist reported she did not
work at the facility when Youth D was placed there.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/29/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective.
Administrator 2 reported after Youth D left the facility and moved
to a foster home that is licensed through the agency, the foster
mom found text messages between Youth D and Staff 1 and
notified the agency via email about it.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on 5/1/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective. Staff 6
reported she has worked at the facility for eight years, with the last
two years being overnight shifts at Ashmun house Sunday through
Wednesday. Staff 6 reported she recalled Staff 1 and had only
worked with him a few times. Staff 6 reported there were times
Staff 1 would stay after his shift ended to talk to youth. Staff 6
reported Staff 1 stayed after his shift “multiple times” for
approximately thirty minutes to an hour. Staff 6 reported some of
10

the occasions Staff 1 had worked in Ashmun house for his shift
and other times he had worked at other houses and then came to
Ashmun after his shift was over. Staff 6 reported it depended on
the week as to how many times he stayed late. Staff 6 reported
Staff 1 would talk to Youth G and would sit in a chair outside
Youth G’s door to talk to her. Staff 6 did not recall Staff 1 talking
to Youth A or Staff 1 being outside Youth A’s bedroom door. Staff
6 reported staff are not supposed to go to another house after
their shift and have been told this several times, unless there is an
issue going on. Staff 6 reported sometimes Staff 1 would be
called to come to Ashmun house by staff, unknown specifically
who. Staff 6 reported other staff at the facility have gone to other
houses after their shift ended to talk to youth however not as
frequently as Staff 1 did. Staff 6 reported she did not recall Youth
A ever asking for Staff 1 to come talk to her. Staff 6 reported Staff
1 “seemed socially awkward” and she did not like the fact he was
coming over after shift however she did not have any experience
of him being inappropriate. Staff 6 reported she completed
checks while Staff 1 was at the house talking to Youth G and she
did not recall any concerning conversations between Staff 6 and
Youth G. Staff 6 reported she did not get any weird vibes when
she completed checks, and he was there. Staff 6 reported she
would get her paperwork around at the beginning of her shift, take
over completing checks on youth, and start laundry. Staff 6
reported some nights she is the only overnight staff and other
nights she has a second overnight staff working with her. Staff 6
did not recall if there were times Staff 1 was there when she was
the only overnight on shift but believed there was. Staff 6 reported
she would complete paperwork in the kitchen area and if she sat
in a specific location she could see the hallway. Staff 6 reported
she normally sits to be able to see down the hallway, however she
can’t guarantee that she would have eyes on the entire time Staff
1 would have been down the hall as she possibly started laundry
knowing Staff 1 was a staff member and was in the hallway. Staff
6 reported she does not know for sure if she was ever there alone
with Staff 1 as there are typically other staff finishing paperwork at
the end of the night. Staff 6 did not recall what other staff would
have worked with her on overnights. Staff 6 reported Youth G
was in the observation room which is the first room in the hallway.
Staff 6 reported she did not recall when Youth A was placed in the
observation bedroom.
Foster Parent was interviewed via telephone on 5/14/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Detective. Foster
Parent reported Youth D was placed in her home in January.
Foster Parent reported she provided Youth D with a cellphone to
11

be able to communicate with Youth D while at school and as
needed. Foster Parent reported Youth D had the phone for one
day prior to Foster Parent being able to set up all the parental
controls on the phone. Foster Parent reported she looked through
Youth D’s phone the day after Youth D was provided with the
phone and came across a phone number. She did not believe the
phone number was labeled as Staff 1. Foster Parent reported the
message from the number who is believed to be Staff 1 asked
Youth D if anyone goes through her phone. Foster Parent
reported it was a “red flag” to her, and she blocked the phone
number from Youth D’s phone and notified the facility as she is a
licensed foster care provider through the agency. Foster Parent
reported Youth D would talk about staff from the facility and how
Youth A would talk a lot about Staff 1 and how he was her
favorite. Youth D told Foster Parent how Staff 1 would bring
snacks for youth at the facility. Foster Parent reported a few
weeks after finding the text message, she checked Youth D’s
phone again and there was a number in the messages that was
not labeled with a name. Foster Parent reported Youth D was not
able to open the message as the number had been blocked due to
the parental blocks. Foster Parent reported the message said
“hey”. Foster Parent reported she had her husband do a phone
number search and the phone number belonged to Staff 1. Foster
Parent reported she asked Youth D if she had ever sent anyone,
not specifically Staff 1, any photographs and Youth D reported she
had not. Foster Parent reported to her knowledge there was no
communication between Youth D and Staff 1 after that. Foster
Parent reported Youth D told her she used a staff phone at the
facility to communicate with Staff 1 after he was no longer
employed at the facility. Foster Parent reported she did not know
who the staff was however believed it was a female with the first
initial “M”. Foster Parent reported Youth D was good at
memorizing numbers and it was possible Youth D memorized
Staff 1’s phone number when the staff would allow Youth D to call
Staff 1. Foster Parent reported Youth D never reported anything
else to her regarding Staff 1. Foster Parent reported Youth D
never reported any “grooming behaviors” regarding Staff 1
however reported Youth D is smart and Foster Parent did not think
Youth D would tell her. Foster Parent reported Youth D was not
allowed to have social media when she was placed in her home,
however Youth D stole another cell phone while at the placement
and signed into her snapchat account. Foster Parent reported she
believes Youth D would get on friend’s cellphones at school and
sign into social media accounts.

Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per interviews it was
determined Staff 1 did not have the ability to perform the functions
of the position, however, it should be noted the facility did
terminate Staff 1’s employment shortly after becoming aware of
concerns regarding Staff 1. Per interviews with staff, concerns
with boundaries began occurring in September/October 2024 with
several staff having concerns of red flags. Administrator 1 was
informed in October 2024 Staff 1 had been in the basement with
Youth A and a staff felt something was not right. Immediately
after being informed, Administrator 1 placed Staff 1 on
administrative leave while an internal investigation was completed
however Staff 1 never returned Administrator 1’s phone calls to
come into the facility regarding the internal investigation and the
facility terminated Staff 1. Video footage during the time Staff 1
was alone in the basement with Youth A was reviewed and found
Staff 1 allowed Youth A to use his cellphone and no other
concerns.
The concerns of Staff 1 having inappropriate relations with Youth
A arose upon a note Youth A wrote to a peer being found on
4/28/2025 indicating inappropriate relations had occurred at which
time Staff 1 was no longer employed at the facility. Per Youth A’s
interview, Youth A reported having sexual interactions with Staff 1
as well as additional concerns of Staff 1 having boundary
concerns with Youth A and Youth D as Staff 1 reportedly reached
out to Youth D after Youth D left the facility. Attempts were made
18

to interview Staff 1 however he did not show up for the scheduled
interview with Detective, MDHHS Worker, and consultant. Staff 1
has not been employed at the facility since 11/4/2024 and the
criminal case will be submitted to the prosecutor’s office to
determine next steps in the criminal case.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
The facility was provided technical assistance on training all staff
on red flags regarding concerns of staff boundaries (staff should
not be staying after shift without supervisor approval, staff should
not be sitting outside youth doors at bedtime without another staff
present, staff should not be one on one in areas with youth not on
camera, and staff should not be having physical contact with youth
including holding hands/ head rested on staff) and all boundary
concerns are to be immediately reported to administration.
Conclusion Violation Established
